item.title: Is Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 The Final Chapter? Poppy Playtime Chapter 6, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 is finally here, and the twisted story of murderous toys continues. However, before it arrived, plenty of fans were theorising that this could be the final Chapter in the series, with a natural conclusion seemingly drawing near.

Well, now that the game is in the hands of the masses, the answer is pretty clear, and it seems like the fanbase is pretty divided on the outcome. If you’re wondering whether Poppy Playtime will continue after Chapter 5, then you’re in the right place, as Insider Gaming has it all figured out.

Is Chapter 5 Of Poppy Playtime The Final Chapter?

No, Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 is not the final chapter. Judging by the ending of Chapter 5, a sixth chapter is all but guaranteed.

Without spoiling the ending, which raises even more questions, it’s clear that Mob Entertainment aren’t quite ready to cut the cord and wrap up Poppy Playtime just yet.

  • More Insider Gaming: How Much Does Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 Cost? Price, Explained

For fans of the franchise, this is great news, as that means there is bound to be even more monstrous cuddly toys to evade and mysteries to uncover. But it also raises a new question: When will Chapter 6 be released?

When Will Poppy Playtime Chapter 6 Release?

Although it may be obvious that Poppy Playtime Chapter 6 is a given, no official confirmation of its existence has been made by Mob Entertainment. Therefore, there’s no official release date to share.

However, chapters for Poppy Playtime have released fairly regularly, with a new one dropping pretty much every year since the franchise began back in 2021.

  • More Insider Gaming: 10 Best Horror Games Ever, From Resident Evil to Outlast

With that in mind, it’s highly likely that Chapter 6 will be released sometime in 2027, though that’s purely speculation. The franchise missed a year of content back in 2023, so it’s not a guarantee, but that would imply that it’d arrive by 2028 at the absolute latest.

What do you think will happen in Chapter 6 of Poppy Playtime? Share your theories in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Poppy Playtime content, check out what platforms Chapter 5 is playable on.

item.title: WWE 2K26 Includes Classic AFI Song for ROH-Era CM Punk
item.content:encoded:
Another first for CM Punk is now checked off the list: his indie wrestling theme song will be included in the next WWE video game.

Today, everyone knows that “Cult of Personality” by Living Colour is the song that plays whenever CM Punk heads to a WWE ring. However, there was a time when “Miseria Cantare: The Beginning” by AFI blared over PA systems as CM Punk made his way to the squared circle in promotions like Ring of Honor and Ohio Valley Wrestling.

In WWE 2K26, young CM Punk is a playable character, and not only have they included his Ring of Honor attire from the early 2000s, but the AFI song is also in the game. This news was reported first by TechRadar.

CM Punk Takes Center Stage in WWE 2K26

Not only is CM Punk the cover star of WWE 2K26, but he’s also the focal point of this year’s 2K Showcase mode. The mode will allow fans to play through many classic CM Punk matches and fantasy matchups that never occurred.

The scenes feature multiple eras of CM Punk over the last two decades, as well as his own custom arena, the CM Punkvillion. Learn more about Showcase mode here.

Additionally, CM Punk is heavily featured in this year’s Island storyline as the leader of one of the core factions, the Order of Anarchy. Learn more about Island mode at this link. 

WWE 2K26 releases globally on March 13. However, if you pre-order any premium edition, you can play the game one week early. For more WWE 2K26 on Insider Gaming, check out the changes coming to WWE Universe mode this year.

Are you excited to relive all of the eras of CM Punk? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Kristen Bell Cast As Amy Rose in Sonic the Hedgehog 4
item.content:encoded:
Amy Rose has found her voice.

Amy Rose was teased at the end of the third Sonic film. Now, the Hollywood Reporter has shared that Kristen Bell has been tapped to voice everyone’s favorite pink Hedgehog in Sonic 4, coming in March 2027. She joins the cast, which includes Jim Carrey, Ben Schwartz, James Marsden, and more.

Past Sonic movies have also featured Idris Elba voicing Knuckles the Echidna and Keanu Reeves voicing Shadow the Hedgehog.

Kristen Bell’s History in Top IPs

Kristen Bell’s most famous voice-acting role is likely Princess Anna in Disney’s Frozen films. However, she’s also known for voicing Lucy in the first Assassin’s Creed game. Now, she adds Amy Rose to the list.

At this time, plot details are scarce regarding the fourth Sonic movie. Amy Rose is best known as the franchise’s most established female character. If you ask Amy, she’s the love of Sonic’s life, but he’s never fully committed to that.

Amy Rose’s History in Sonic the Hedgehog

The character debuted in Sonic CD in 1993 but became a focal point of the Sonic the Hedgehog franchise with Sonic Adventure in 1999.

The character has regularly appeared in games since then, sometimes as a playable character. She’s also been a key player in the Sonic X, Sonic Prime, and Sonic Boom cartoons.

Recently, Sega announced plans to bring other IPs from the ’90s into animation. Learn more about what to expect in the near future from Sega at this link.

Are you looking forward to the fourth Sonic the Hedgehog movie? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Todd Howard Shuts Down ‘Starfield 2.0’ Claims and Promises More News ‘Soonish’
item.content:encoded:
Todd Howard of Bethesda Game Studios has put a spanner in the works of everyone hoping for a Starfield resurgence by closing down claims that ‘Starfield 2.0’ is on the horizon (or the event horizon? Space joke).

Recently, those who attended behind-closed-doors sessions hosted by Bethesda were quickly taking to social media to pledge the imminent evolution of the game, but Todd Howard wants to set expectations straight. He has done so in a new interview by stressing that everything going forward will be about Starfield.

Bethesda Game Studios is Focusing Big Time on Starfield

Starfield hasn’t exactly had the most love from Bethesda Game Studios. The game dropped in September 2023, and despite claims of a yearly DLC release schedule, we’ve had just one expansion land – Shattered Space. That expansion was known about long before the game came out, but by today, the game’s second expansion hasn’t been unveiled by the company behind the space-faring RPG.

Like other Bethesda titles, Starfield has relied heavily on the modding community to keep the content flowing.

However, now that the Fallout TV show has wrapped and Bethesda is looking to make Fallout 76’s content updates less ambitious, more focus can be applied to Starfield. In a recent interview with Kinda Funny, that’s exactly what Howard alluded to:

Obviously, we’ve been working on a lot of Starfield content, we haven’t talked about it yet. The end of last year for us was prickly, for us – we have periods where we focus on IPs and franchises, and Fallout obviously dominated the fall and earlier this year, but you’ve seen it.

And I can tell everybody we’re gonna be talking about it really soon. We’re moving into a phase where we’re going to be talking about Starfield and really show that in the right way.

He then shut down the rumors and claims about Starfield 2.0, the sought-after next level of the sci-fi RPG that everyone believes would make it worth playing again.

It is not Starfield 2.0 – I’ve seen some of that, and for expectation setting – I think it’s the kinda thing where – if you like Starfield, we think you’re going to love this. It’s updates and things that change the game, not in an isolated way, but you know ‘meta’ – using outer space and things in ways that we haven’t.

But if Starfield is something that didn’t connect with you right away, or you bounced off it, or found it boring in places – I don’t think it’s going to change that fundamentally, but if you’re someone who loves Starfield and we think, we’re really happy with it.

(Thanks to DayOne for the quotes)

Starfield is in dire need of a resurgence, especially as we’re not getting a new Fallout game for many years and The Elder Scrolls 6 doesn’t seem to be surfacing any time soon. Once upon a time, Starfield was the most hotly anticipated game in the business, but now it feels ready to be forgotten.

Do you want to see more energy funnelled into making Starfield great again? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Escape from Tarkov has a new roadmap

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#984)—Answers for Thursday, February 19
item.content:encoded:
It’s almost the end of another week, and hopefully you’re ending it as strong as your streak is going right now (potentially). We’ve got another slammer of an NYT Connections puzzle to grind through today, but if you want to solve it as quickly as possible, just scroll down and pick out my best NYT Connections hints.

If you don’t want the answer straight away, I’ve got NYT Connections clues for you, but if you do, just hit the bottom of the page to secure what you need to know.

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing lineup of the New York Times titles. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available worldwide and can be played on desktop devices or in a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words can have double meanings, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty, from least to most.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 19)

Here are the words from today’s NYT Connections puzzle:

  • BASKET
  • BELLOWS
  • DYE
  • POKER
  • EGGS
  • SHOVEL
  • PEEPS
  • TONGS
  • DISCO
  • BOYLE
  • JOHN TRAVOLTA
  • BRAYS
  • PLATFORM SHOES
  • SEAR
  • POLYESTER SUIT
  • STU

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Words you’d associate with easter
  • Green – Things that are used around a fireplace
  • Blue – Words linked to the Saturday Night Fever movie
  • Purple – Words that sound like ways to cook something

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 19:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 19 (#984)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – BASKET, DYE, EGGS, PEEPS
  • Green – BELLOWS, POKER, SHOVEL, TONGS
  • Blue – DISCO, JOHN TRAVOLTA, PLATFORM SHOES, POLYESTER SUIT
  • Purple – BOYLE, BRAYS, SEER, STU

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1706: Hints and Answer for February 19, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1706 for February 19, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, February 19, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1706 is an easy puzzle. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 3.8 out of 6 guesses. That makes it even easier than the 4-guess average from February 18.

General Wordle Hints For February 19

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word describes an intentional physical action.
  • Hint 2: It’s commonly used when something is moved upward rather than sideways.
  • Hint 3: The action usually involves effort or assistance, not ease.
  • Hint 4: You’ll often see this word used in construction, nautical, or mechanical contexts.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1706 for February 19, 2026.

Starter Words For February 19, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • JOUST
  • SHOUT
  • POINT
  • SIGHT
  • JOIST

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1706 On February 19, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: HOIST

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

HOIST can be both a noun and a verb. As a verb, it means “to raise or lift, especially by some mechanical appliance.” As a noun, it means “an apparatus for hoisting, as a block and tackle, a derrick, or a crane.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1705 on February 18, 2026

Answer: MOGUL

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1706?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on February 20 will be Wordle Game #1707.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…
